page.title: 19A WINLATON COUNCILLOR
page.content: Mr. Bob Baker has been a member of Gateshead Council for the last eight years. When asked about changes in Winlaton he replied that in his lifetime it had grown from a small village into a large town. He said that Winlaton people used to be called "spikers", but that now they are called "Winlatoners". He believed that the town had changed for the better. He said in reply to a question that vandalism was a modern problem that involves young people. He said that he did well at School, and that he had taken his "O" Levels and gone on to University, all of which he had found useful. Asked if he had met any famous people he replied that he had met the Queen and Mr. Neil Kinnock.
